messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] BABIES!!!
messages.msgSnippet: amy, we live in a cape with 2 br s up & 2 down, but we use the big 1 d-stairs as a playroom & the litle 1 d-stairs as an office/computer room. so at night we
messages.messageBody:
amy,
we live in a cape with 2 br's up & 2 down, but we use the big 1 d-stairs as a
playroom & the litle 1 d-stairs as an office/computer room. so at night we
have my 8 & 5 yo boys & 11/2 yr old daughter in with us on futon on floor &
my 13 yo son sleeps alone across the hall while we are all squished in my
room! LOL!
Bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] BABIES!!!
messages.msgSnippet: hahahaha!!! I ve been told we can t have more than 3 cos we d have to get an MPV!!!  Dh wouldn t be seen DEAD with one on the drive  I ve always wanted 4
messages.messageBody:
hahahaha!!! I've been told we can't have more than 3 cos we'd have to get an MPV!!!  Dh wouldn't be seen DEAD with one on the drive <bg>
 
I've always wanted 4 or 6.  So I think after the next, any more may have to be 'accidents.'  LMAO :-}
 
Tracy
----- Original Message -----
From: K WORTHEN
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 17, 2000 12:20 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] BABIES!!!

I just had to chime in on this one. I was so disapointed when dh told me it
wasn't realistic for me to keep having babies and I said I would stop once
we had grand kids LOL. Unfortunatly due to space limitations I think we're
going to have to be done at 3, althogh we won't do anything permantly. If we
ever get out of our tiny little 2br. house I'd be pregnant with #4 as soon
as we sign the purchase and sale.<G>
Amy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] BABIES!!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/17/00 6:19:30 AM Central Daylight Time, kworthen@mediaone.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/17/00 6:19:30 AM Central Daylight Time,
kworthen@... writes:

<< I was so disapointed when dh told me it
wasn't realistic for me to keep having babies and I said I would stop once
we had grand kids LOL. Unfortunatly due to space limitations I think we're
going to have to be done at 3 >>

Amy,
I can relate to this! I always dreamed of having a house FULL of kids (I
read Cheaper By The Dozen about a million times). Lupus and lack of $$$
forced me to change my plans. I have to remind myself that 3 is plenty, and
that someday I'll get my hands on some grandbabies! I hope my sons marry
baby-crazy women! As for my daughter, I hope my feelings wear off on her and
spur her to have lots of beautiful fat babies for me to love.

*** KiM ***
runs with scissors
